item.title: Wrong, not confused
item.author: ashander AT rff org (Jaime Ashander)
item.description: Quoting Turchin (1998) quoting Hull (1988) quoting Bacon (?) : In science it is better to be wrong than confused. The point is, though a mathematical model that purports to repesent reality will be wrong, one with clear definitions and assumptions can be helpful. Mathematical modeling is a tool to move from confusion about a process to making clear (if wrong) statements about that process.
